purpose: Track errors, solutions, and lessons learned during development

errorSolutions.description: Solutions to specific errors encountered during development

entries.error: FastEmbed memory leak with large batches
entries.solution: Use generator pattern with explicit cleanup: process in small batches (16 for CPU), call gc.collect() between batches, and use streaming instead of loading all at once
entries.context: FastEmbed v0.7.1 has known memory issues when processing large numbers of embeddings

entries.error: Search returns only crate-level docs
entries.solution: Modified module_pattern filtering to include both the module itself AND items within it using OR clause: 'WHERE (module_name = ? OR module_name LIKE ?) AND ...' instead of just exact module matching
entries.context: Vector search was filtering too strictly and only returning crate-level documentation, missing specific module content
entries.codeExample: WHERE (embeddings.module_name = ? OR embeddings.module_name LIKE ?) AND embeddings.item_type != 'crate' AND embeddings.rowid IN (SELECT rowid FROM vss_embeddings WHERE vss_search(embeddings_vec, ?) AND k = ?)

entries.error: sqlite-vec k parameter errors
entries.solution: Added explicit 'AND k = ?' to WHERE clause as required by sqlite-vec. The k parameter must be included in the query constraints, not just as a LIMIT clause
entries.context: sqlite-vec extension requires the k parameter to be explicitly specified in the WHERE clause for vector similarity searches

entries.error: Unhelpful validation error messages
entries.solution: Enhanced validators to include valid ranges and examples in error messages. For example: 'k must be between 1-20, got 25. Use k=5 for standard results' instead of just 'invalid k value'
entries.context: Generic validation errors made it difficult for users to understand what values were acceptable
entries.codeExample: raise ValueError(f'k must be between 1-{MAX_K}, got {k}. Use k=5 for standard results')

entries.error: searchExamples returns fragmented characters
entries.solution: Added defensive type checking and proper string wrapping to prevent character iteration. Ensure examples are treated as complete strings rather than iterables of characters
entries.context: When examples were strings, they were being treated as iterables and returned character by character instead of as complete example strings
entries.codeExample: if isinstance(examples, str): examples = [examples]  # Wrap single string in list

commonErrors.description: Frequently encountered errors and their solutions

entries.error: SQLite threading error with aiosqlite
entries.context: Database operations in async context
entries.solution: Use aiosqlite properly with await db.execute() instead of synchronous calls
entries.prevention: Always use await with aiosqlite operations, never mix sync/async database calls

entries.error: no such function: vec_distance
entries.context: Vector similarity search queries in SQLite with vss extension
entries.solution: Use MATCH operator instead of vec_distance() function for vector searches
entries.prevention: Reference sqlite-vss documentation for correct query syntax

entries.error: LIMIT or 'k = ?' constraint required
entries.context: Vector similarity search queries without proper constraints
entries.solution: Add 'AND k = ?' parameter to MATCH queries to specify result count
entries.prevention: Always include k parameter in vector search queries

entries.error: ijson expects binary input but sometimes receives string
entries.context: JSON streaming during ingestion pipeline processing
entries.solution: Use io.BytesIO(json_content.encode()) instead of io.StringIO for binary input
entries.prevention: Always ensure ijson receives bytes input by encoding strings first

entries.error: AsyncMock context managers require proper setup
entries.context: Testing async context managers with unittest.mock
entries.solution: Set up __aenter__ and __aexit__ methods explicitly on AsyncMock objects
entries.prevention: Use MagicMock for session objects or properly configure AsyncMock context manager methods

entries.error: pytest-asyncio fixture compatibility issues in 0.23.x versions
entries.context: Testing async functions and fixtures with pytest-asyncio
entries.solution: Downgrade to pytest-asyncio==0.21.1 for stable async fixture support
entries.prevention: Pin pytest-asyncio to 0.21.1 in development dependencies and avoid 0.23.x until issues are resolved

entries.error: prometheus-client memory leak warnings in high-cardinality scenarios
entries.context: Prometheus metrics collection with many unique label combinations
entries.solution: Monitor memory usage and implement label cardinality limits, use histogram buckets instead of individual metrics where possible
entries.prevention: Design metric labels carefully to avoid high cardinality, regularly review metric memory footprint in production
references: Prometheus best practices documentation on cardinality

entries.error: fetch_current_stable_version session parameter missing
entries.context: HTTP session not properly passed to version fetching function
entries.solution: Always pass aiohttp session parameter to fetch_current_stable_version function calls
entries.prevention: Use type hints and validate session parameter in function signature

entries.error: hypothesis module not found for property-based testing
entries.context: Running property-based tests that require hypothesis library
entries.solution: Install hypothesis for property-based testing support
entries.prevention: Include hypothesis in development dependencies for comprehensive testing

entries.error: Variable scope in exception handlers
entries.context: Referencing variables in exception blocks that may not be defined
entries.solution: Avoid referencing variables that may not be defined in exception scope
entries.prevention: Initialize variables before try blocks or check existence in except blocks

entries.error: cursor.lastrowid returns None when using executemany() in aiosqlite
entries.context: Batch insert operations needing to track inserted row IDs
entries.solution: Use 'SELECT last_insert_rowid()' after executemany() to get the last inserted rowid
entries.prevention: Never rely on cursor.lastrowid with executemany(), always use SQL query for rowid

entries.error: SQLite parameter limit exceeded in batch operations
entries.context: Inserting large batches with multiple parameters per row
entries.solution: SQLite parameter limit is 999, not 1000 - calculate batch size as 999 // params_per_row
entries.prevention: Always account for SQLite's 999 parameter limit when batching operations

entries.error: Loop variable overwriting in extract_code_examples
entries.context: Variable name collision causing data loss in rustdoc parsing
entries.solution: Use different variable names (cleaned_example vs example) to avoid overwriting loop variables
entries.prevention: Always use distinct variable names in nested loops and data processing to prevent accidental overwrites

entries.error: Type matching too broad in rustdoc parsing
entries.context: String matching 'type' in 'unknown_type' causing incorrect type categorization
entries.solution: Use exact key matching in type_map dictionary instead of substring matching
entries.prevention: Use precise key matching instead of substring matching for dictionary lookups to avoid false positives

entries.error: Path objects in test mocks must use MagicMock with proper spec
entries.context: Testing functions that check Path.exists() method with mocked Path objects
entries.solution: Use MagicMock(spec=Path) and configure exists() method explicitly: mock_path = MagicMock(spec=Path); mock_path.exists.return_value = True
entries.prevention: Always use spec parameter with MagicMock when mocking complex objects to ensure method availability

entries.error: sqlite-vec MATCH operator requires explicit k parameter
entries.context: Vector similarity search queries failing with 'A LIMIT or 'k = ?' constraint is required' error
entries.solution: Always include explicit k parameter in MATCH queries: 'SELECT * FROM vec_table WHERE vec_column MATCH ? AND k = ?'
entries.prevention: Never use MATCH operator without k parameter - sqlite-vec requires this constraint for all vector searches

entries.error: See-also suggestions showing duplicate results from original search
entries.context: Implementing see-also functionality that excludes original search results to avoid redundancy
entries.solution: Filter out original search results from suggestions using path exclusion: exclude_paths = {result.path for result in original_results}
entries.prevention: Always exclude original search results when generating related suggestions to provide truly additional value

entries.error: Similarity score calculation incorrect for sqlite-vec cosine distance
entries.context: Converting sqlite-vec distance to similarity score for ranking purposes
entries.solution: Use similarity = 1.0 - distance formula for cosine distance in sqlite-vec to get proper similarity scores (higher = more similar)
entries.prevention: Remember sqlite-vec returns distance (lower = more similar), convert to similarity (higher = more similar) with 1.0 - distance

entries.error: Test mocks for ingest_crate returning string instead of Path object
entries.context: Testing ingest_crate function where db_path.exists() is called but mock returns string
entries.solution: Mock ingest_crate to return Path object with exists() method: mock_result = MagicMock(spec=Path); mock_result.exists.return_value = True; return mock_result
entries.prevention: When mocking functions that return Path objects, ensure the mock returns objects with proper Path methods configured

entries.error: Path resolution not finding items without explicit path mapping
entries.context: Items without path mappings in rustdoc JSON causing lookup failures
entries.solution: Implement fallback to item name when no path mapping exists in rustdoc data
entries.prevention: Always provide fallback mechanisms when working with optional or incomplete data structures

entries.error: Mock aiohttp sessions need proper async context manager setup
entries.context: Testing async HTTP operations with unittest.mock.AsyncMock
entries.solution: Mock aiohttp sessions need __aenter__ and __aexit__ methods configured for async context manager usage
entries.prevention: Always configure AsyncMock context manager methods when testing async sessions or use MagicMock for session objects

entries.error: Rust version fetch failures break stdlib detection
entries.context: Network issues or API failures when fetching current Rust version for stdlib crate filtering
entries.solution: Always provide fallback version when fetching Rust version fails, use hardcoded recent version as default
entries.prevention: Implement graceful degradation with fallback values for external API dependencies

entries.error: Rustdoc JSON URL pattern redirecting unexpectedly
entries.context: Initial URL pattern /crate/{crate}/latest was redirecting to different endpoints
entries.solution: Use new docs.rs API pattern /crate/{crate-name}/{version}/json for direct access
entries.prevention: Always use version-specific URLs for docs.rs API to avoid redirect overhead

entries.error: Zstd compression not detected in HTTP responses
entries.context: JSON responses were compressed but compression detection was failing
entries.solution: Check magic bytes (0x28, 0xb5, 0x2f, 0xfd) to detect zstd compression instead of relying on headers
entries.prevention: Always check magic bytes for compression detection as headers may be unreliable

entries.error: Module extraction receiving strings instead of dictionaries
entries.context: build_module_hierarchy was receiving string paths instead of full path_info dictionaries
entries.solution: Store full path_info dict in paths_data for hierarchy building instead of just path strings
entries.prevention: Always preserve full data structures when building hierarchies to maintain context information

entries.error: Item kind field not directly available in rustdoc index
entries.context: Kind field was not found directly in rustdoc JSON index items
entries.solution: Extract kind from inner field as single-key dictionary instead of direct access
entries.prevention: Always inspect rustdoc JSON structure carefully as fields may be nested unexpectedly

entries.error: Module names empty in hierarchy extraction
entries.context: Module names were showing as empty in the extracted hierarchy structure
entries.solution: Module name is last element of path array, not a separate name field
entries.prevention: Understand rustdoc JSON path structure where item names are derived from path arrays

entries.error: NameError: name 'Optional' is not defined
entries.context: Code example extraction implementation missing Optional type import
entries.solution: Added Optional to typing imports: 'from typing import Any, Optional'
entries.prevention: Always import all required typing components when adding type hints

entries.error: no such column: crate_version
entries.context: Database schema missing crate_version column during code example queries
entries.solution: Extract version from database filename pattern (e.g., '1.0.219.db' → '1.0.219')
entries.prevention: Extract crate version from database file path when schema doesn't include version column

entries.error: no such function: vec_distance_L2
entries.context: sqlite-vec extension not loaded before vector similarity queries
entries.solution: Load extension before queries: await db.enable_load_extension(True); await db.execute(f'SELECT load_extension('{sqlite_vec.loadable_path()}')'); await db.enable_load_extension(False)
entries.prevention: Always load sqlite-vec extension before performing any vector operations

entries.error: 'str' object has no attribute 'get'
entries.context: Backward compatibility issue with old list format vs new JSON format for code examples
entries.solution: Handle both old list format and new JSON format: if isinstance(examples_data, list) and all(isinstance(e, str) for e in examples_data): examples_data = [{'code': e, 'language': 'rust', 'detected': False} for e in examples_data]
entries.prevention: Always implement backward compatibility checks when changing data formats

entries.error: searchExamples character fragmentation - returns individual characters instead of code blocks
entries.context: ingest.py:761 and app.py:614-620 - for loop iterates over string as characters when examples_data is string type
entries.solution: Add type check before iteration: if isinstance(examples_data, str): examples_data = [examples_data]; for example in examples_data: # Now safely iterate list. Applied in both generate_example_embeddings (ingest.py:758-762) and searchExamples (app.py:614-620)
entries.prevention: Always validate data types before iteration, especially when data might be either string or list
symptoms: Each character returned as separate example
Affects all crates with code examples
entries.rootCause: String iteration returns characters when examples_data is string type instead of list
entries.testingVerification: Verified with live MCP calls to serde crate
entries.resolutionStatus: FIXED - Applied type guard pattern in both locations, tested and verified working
entries.impact: Fixed critical bug that rendered searchExamples unusable, now returns complete code blocks instead of individual characters

entries.error: MCP parameter validation - numeric parameters like k=2 rejected
entries.context: MCP manifest missing anyOf patterns for type flexibility with numeric values
entries.solution: Update MCP manifest with anyOf pattern: 'k': {'anyOf': [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}]} in src/docsrs_mcp/app.py:151-297
entries.prevention: Always use anyOf patterns in MCP manifests for parameters that may arrive as different types from various clients
entries.note: Models.py has coercion but manifest needs updating for JSON Schema validation

entries.error: Path resolution exactness - common paths like serde::Deserialize return 404
entries.context: Users expect common module paths to work but need exact rustdoc paths
entries.solution: Add PATH_ALIASES dictionary in fuzzy_resolver.py with mappings like 'serde::Deserialize': 'serde::de::Deserialize', 'tokio::spawn': 'tokio::task::spawn', 'Result': 'std::result::Result'
entries.prevention: Maintain common path aliases for frequently accessed items to improve user experience
entries.currentBehavior: Provides fuzzy suggestions but requires exact module paths

entries.error: crates.io API returns different structure than expected
entries.context: API response validation during crate data fetching
entries.solution: Added response validation to check for required fields and anomalies (zero downloads for popular crates)
entries.prevention: Always validate API responses for expected structure and detect data anomalies before processing

entries.error: Concurrent cache file access can cause corruption
entries.context: Multiple processes accessing cache files simultaneously
entries.solution: Implemented file locking with FileLock and atomic writes (temp file + rename)
entries.prevention: Use file locking mechanisms and atomic write operations for concurrent file access

entries.error: API failures can cascade and overwhelm system
entries.context: Multiple API failures causing system overload
entries.solution: Circuit breaker pattern with 5-minute cooldown after 3 failures
entries.prevention: Implement circuit breaker patterns to prevent cascading failures and system overload

entries.error: Search filtering excluding function-level items
entries.context: Overly restrictive crate_pattern and module_pattern filters in database search queries
entries.solution: Review filter logic in database.py lines 487-491 to ensure function-level items are not excluded by restrictive path pattern matching
entries.prevention: Test search queries against diverse item types including functions, methods, and traits to ensure inclusive filtering

entries.error: sqlite-vec requires explicit k parameter in WHERE clauses
entries.context: Vector similarity queries failing when using only LIMIT without k constraint
entries.solution: Always use 'WHERE vector_column MATCH ? AND k = N' instead of relying on LIMIT clause for sqlite-vec queries
entries.prevention: Remember sqlite-vec requires explicit k constraint in WHERE clause, not just LIMIT in query

entries.error: Model loading delay on first request
entries.context: Embedding model initialization causes slow first response
entries.solution: Model loading happens on first embedding generation - expected behavior
entries.prevention: Consider warming up models during server startup for production

entries.error: Large download and decompression memory usage
entries.context: Ingesting large crates with streaming downloads and decompression
entries.solution: Use streaming with reasonable limits: DOWNLOAD_CHUNK_SIZE=8KB, MAX_DOWNLOAD_SIZE=100MB, MAX_DECOMPRESSED_SIZE=100MB
entries.prevention: Set appropriate memory limits and use chunked processing for large files

entries.issue: Example embeddings memory usage and search performance
entries.solution: Implemented streaming generation with batch size 16 for CPU, hash-based deduplication to reduce storage by ~30%, and dedicated sqlite-vec tables for faster search
entries.context: When generating embeddings for code examples, memory can accumulate quickly with FastEmbed. Using generators and explicit cleanup between batches keeps memory under control.

entries.solution: Initial queries slow until vectors cached, implement cache warming for popular crates
entries.context: First-time vector searches experience significant latency due to model loading and cache population

entries.solution: Already using streaming + generators, monitor with psutil for proactive management
entries.context: Large crates can cause memory spikes despite streaming implementation

entries.error: Memory usage approaching 1GB limit during pre-ingestion
entries.context: High memory usage during concurrent crate processing
entries.solution: Added adaptive concurrency that reduces workers when RSS > 900MB
entries.prevention: Monitor RSS memory usage and implement adaptive concurrency limits

entries.error: Cold start latency for popular crates
entries.context: Initial requests for popular crates take too long to respond
entries.solution: Pre-ingestion with priority queue ensures most-downloaded crates processed first
entries.prevention: Implement pre-ingestion strategies with priority-based processing

entries.error: Cache staleness during high traffic
entries.context: Cached data becomes stale during high-traffic periods
entries.solution: Stale-while-revalidate pattern serves cached data while refreshing in background
entries.prevention: Implement stale-while-revalidate caching patterns for high-traffic scenarios

entries.solution: Consider Nucleo library for 6x faster path-specific fuzzy matching compared to current RapidFuzz implementation
entries.context: Path resolution and fuzzy matching can be optimized for better search performance

entries.solution: Implement hybrid search combining vector similarity (60%) with BM25 keyword search (40%) for better balanced results
entries.context: Pure vector similarity may miss exact keyword matches that users expect

integrationChallenges.description: Issues with third-party services and libraries

entries.error: SQLite extension loading issues
entries.context: Loading sqlite-vss extension for vector operations
entries.solution: Use SELECT load_extension() SQL command instead of direct Python extension loading
entries.prevention: Always use SQL-based extension loading for better compatibility

entries.error: Server startup hanging terminal
entries.context: Running development server blocks terminal session
entries.solution: Use nohup and background process with PID tracking: 'nohup uv run docsrs-mcp > server.log 2>&1 & echo $!'
entries.prevention: Always run servers in background for development, save PID for cleanup

entries.error: Windows executable issues in CI/CD
entries.context: Windows builds failing due to executable path resolution
entries.solution: Use 'uv run' pattern consistently across all platforms instead of direct executable calls
entries.prevention: Standardize on 'uv run' commands in CI workflows to ensure cross-platform compatibility

entries.error: PyPI authentication token issues
entries.context: Publishing to PyPI fails with authentication errors
entries.solution: Use UV_PUBLISH_TOKEN environment variable, not UV_PUBLISH_PASSWORD for PyPI authentication
entries.prevention: Always use UV_PUBLISH_TOKEN for PyPI publishing in CI/CD pipelines

entries.error: Background server testing hangs CI runners
entries.context: CI/CD runners hang when testing servers without proper process management
entries.solution: Use nohup with PID capture pattern: 'nohup uv run server > server.log 2>&1 & echo $!' and kill with captured PID
entries.prevention: Never use bare background processes in CI, always capture PID for cleanup

entries.error: UV cache deserialization errors between versions
entries.context: Different UV versions in CI causing cache corruption and build failures
entries.solution: Pin UV version in CI workflows or clear cache when UV version changes
entries.prevention: Use consistent UV versions across all CI jobs and environments

entries.error: PyPI build compatibility issues
entries.context: Package builds failing on PyPI due to source file inclusion
entries.solution: Use 'uv build --no-sources' for PyPI-compatible builds that exclude source files
entries.prevention: Test builds with --no-sources flag before publishing to ensure PyPI compatibility

entries.error: Self-hosted runner cache inefficiencies
entries.context: Self-hosted runners using different cache strategies than GitHub-hosted runners
entries.solution: Implement runner-specific cache strategies: local disk cache for self-hosted, GitHub Actions cache for hosted
entries.prevention: Configure cache strategies based on runner type to optimize build performance

mcpImplementation.description: MCP server implementation patterns and solutions

entries.error: STDIO corruption in MCP mode
entries.context: Logging output interferes with MCP protocol communication
entries.solution: Configure logging to stderr only in MCP mode to prevent STDIO corruption
entries.prevention: Always configure logging handlers appropriately for MCP vs REST modes

entries.error: FastAPI to MCP protocol conversion
entries.context: Converting REST endpoints to MCP protocol automatically
entries.solution: Use FastMCP.from_fastapi() to automatically convert REST endpoints to MCP protocol
entries.prevention: Leverage FastMCP for seamless protocol conversion instead of manual implementation

entries.error: MCP server testing difficulties
entries.context: Testing MCP server requires background process management
entries.solution: MCP server can be tested in background with nohup, kill with captured PID
entries.prevention: Use proper background process management for MCP server testing

entries.error: Claude Desktop MCP configuration
entries.context: Configuring MCP server in Claude Desktop client
entries.solution: Use simplified args: ["docsrs-mcp"] since MCP is now the default mode
entries.prevention: MCP mode is default, no need for explicit --mode mcp flag in Claude Desktop config

entries.error: MCP server debugging challenges
entries.context: Debugging issues with MCP protocol communication
entries.solution: Check server logs in stderr, use --mode rest flag for easier debugging
entries.prevention: Use REST mode (--mode rest) for development debugging since MCP is now default

entries.error: MCP parameter type coercion: string numerics not converted to integers
entries.context: MCP clients (Claude Code) send k parameter as string "3" instead of integer 3, causing Pydantic validation error
entries.solution: Add Pydantic field validator with mode='before' to convert string numbers to integers: @field_validator('k', mode='before')
entries.prevention: FastMCP's automatic type conversion has known issues with string-to-int conversion. Always use Pydantic field validators with mode='before' for numeric parameters that MCP clients might send as strings

entries.error: Pydantic field_validator decorator ordering with @classmethod
entries.context: MCP parameter validation with custom field validators using @classmethod decorator
entries.solution: Always use @field_validator BEFORE @classmethod decorator, not after. The correct order is: @field_validator('field_name', mode='before') followed by @classmethod
entries.prevention: Remember decorator execution order: decorators are applied bottom-up, so @field_validator must come first to properly wrap the classmethod
entries.resolutionStatus: Critical decorator ordering pattern established for all future MCP parameter validators

entries.error: MCP tool schema validation preventing field validator execution
entries.context: searchItems tool fails with validation error when k parameter provided as string '5' by MCP clients. Error: "'5' is not valid under any of the given schemas"
entries.solution: Update MCP manifest schema to use anyOf pattern accepting both string and integer types: 'anyOf': [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}]. This allows JSON Schema validation to pass so Pydantic field validator can perform type coercion
entries.prevention: When FastMCP tools need to accept parameters that might come as different types, use anyOf schema pattern to handle double validation. MCP JSON Schema validates before Pydantic field validators can run, creating conflicts between type constraints and coercion logic
entries.resolutionStatus: Fixed and tested on 2025-08-05. Solution confirmed working with both integer and string k parameters

entries.error: MCP client string parameter conversion validation patterns
entries.context: Implementing robust parameter validation for MCP clients that send numeric values as strings
entries.solution: Use comprehensive validation pattern: 1) Check for None first (return None or default), 2) Check if already correct type (return as-is), 3) Handle string conversion with try/catch, 4) Provide helpful error messages with examples, 5) Handle integer-to-float conversion for float fields
entries.prevention: Always implement the full validation pattern for any numeric parameter that might arrive as a string from MCP clients. Test both native type and string conversion paths
entries.resolutionStatus: Comprehensive validation pattern established and tested with various input types

entries.error: ValidationError vs ValueError in custom Pydantic validators
entries.context: Testing MCP parameter validation with different error types from built-in vs custom validators
entries.solution: Built-in Pydantic constraints raise ValidationError for direct type violations, while custom field_validator methods raise ValueError for string conversion failures. Test accordingly: expect ValidationError for direct types, ValueError for string conversion
entries.prevention: Understand the distinction between Pydantic's built-in validation (ValidationError) and custom validator errors (ValueError) when writing tests
entries.resolutionStatus: Error type patterns documented and test cases updated accordingly

entries.error: Float string conversion error message patterns
entries.context: Testing float parameter validation with invalid string inputs
entries.solution: Use 'could not convert' in error message checks instead of 'invalid literal' for float string conversion failures. Python's float() function uses different error messages than int()
entries.prevention: When testing string-to-float conversion errors, use appropriate error message patterns specific to float conversion
entries.resolutionStatus: Float conversion error patterns identified and test assertions updated

entries.error: MCP Manifest vs Implementation Discrepancy
entries.context: Code review identified issues with boolean parameters that were actually handled correctly in implementation
entries.solution: Update MCP manifest to use anyOf patterns for boolean parameters matching the approach for numeric parameters. Boolean parameters should use anyOf: [{'type': 'boolean'}, {'type': 'string'}] to handle string-to-boolean conversion
entries.prevention: Always ensure MCP manifest schema matches the actual validation capabilities. When Pydantic validators can handle type coercion, the MCP manifest should use anyOf patterns to prevent JSON Schema validation from blocking the conversion
entries.resolutionStatus: Investigation complete - manifest schema alignment with implementation validation needed

entries.error: MCP boolean parameter validation errors with string inputs
entries.context: MCP clients sending boolean parameters as strings (e.g., 'true', 'false') caused validation errors in search_items tool
entries.solution: Use anyOf pattern in MCP manifest schema: {'anyOf': [{'type': 'boolean'}, {'type': 'string'}]} to allow both boolean and string types through JSON Schema validation, then let Pydantic field validators handle conversion with mode='before'
entries.prevention: FastMCP performs double validation - JSON Schema first, then Pydantic. anyOf patterns must be in the manifest schema to allow flexible types through to Pydantic validators. Follow existing numeric parameter patterns for consistency

additionalInfo.serverTesting: Use --mode rest with docsrs-mcp to test MCP manifest endpoints at localhost:8000 (not 8080)
additionalInfo.validationFlow: MCP manifest anyOf → FastMCP JSON Schema validation → Pydantic field_validator with mode='before' → Boolean conversion
additionalInfo.patternConsistency: Follow existing numeric parameter anyOf patterns for all flexible types

entries.resolutionStatus: Fixed and tested - boolean parameters now accept both native booleans and string representations

entries.lesson: Critical searchExamples character fragmentation bug and testing methodology
entries.context: searchExamples returns individual characters instead of complete code blocks due to string iteration bug
entries.solution: Always test with direct MCP calls instead of REST to catch protocol-specific issues. Use fresh databases to avoid legacy data conflicts. Fix requires type checking before iteration in ingest.py:761
entries.prevention: Implement comprehensive testing methodology: 1) Test searchExamples returns full code blocks not characters, 2) Test common path aliases resolve correctly, 3) Test numeric parameters accept both integer and string types, 4) Verify response times <500ms for warm queries, 5) Always use fresh databases for testing to avoid cached data issues

testingMethodology.directMcpTesting: Use mcp__docsrs__ tools directly instead of REST endpoints
testingMethodology.freshDatabases: Always test with new DBs to avoid legacy data issues
verificationSteps: 1. Test searchExamples returns full code blocks
3. Test numeric parameters accept both types

entries.error: MCP clients sending numeric/boolean values as strings cause validation failures
entries.context: MCP clients (including Claude Code) send parameters like k=2 as string '2' and boolean parameters as 'true'/'false' strings, causing JSON Schema validation errors before Pydantic field validators can perform type coercion
entries.solution: Add anyOf patterns to all parameters with type coercion needs in the MCP manifest (app.py's get_mcp_manifest() function): 1) Numeric parameters: 'anyOf': [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}], 2) Boolean parameters: 'anyOf': [{'type': 'boolean'}, {'type': 'string'}], 3) Optional strings: 'anyOf': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'null'}]. Important: anyOf patterns must be added in app.py's get_mcp_manifest() function, not in models.py
entries.prevention: Always use anyOf patterns in MCP manifests for parameters that may arrive as different types from various clients. Test with both native types and strings using curl to ensure compatibility. All parameters with field validators in models.py need corresponding anyOf patterns in app.py
entries.validationFlow: MCP manifest anyOf → FastMCP JSON Schema validation → Pydantic field validators → Type coercion
entries.testingNotes: Verify with curl using both native types and strings: curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"k": "5"}' and curl -X POST -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"k": 5}'

criticalDetails.doubleValidation: FastMCP performs JSON Schema validation before Pydantic field validators run
criticalDetails.patternRequired: anyOf patterns are essential - restrictive schemas block field validator execution
criticalDetails.implementationNote: Field validators handle conversion, manifest must allow types through

entries.resolutionStatus: FIXED - Applied anyOf patterns for numeric and boolean parameters, tested and verified working with both string and native type inputs

entries.error: Path alias resolution for common Rust documentation paths
entries.context: Users often use common aliases (serde::Deserialize) instead of full rustdoc paths (serde::de::Deserialize), causing 404 errors and poor user experience
entries.solution: Implement static PATH_ALIASES dictionary with O(1) lookup before database query. Contains mappings like 'serde::Deserialize': 'serde::de::Deserialize', 'tokio::spawn': 'tokio::task::spawn', 'Result': 'std::result::Result'. Uses resolve_path_alias() function in fuzzy_resolver.py for efficient resolution
entries.prevention: Maintain PATH_ALIASES dictionary with common path aliases for frequently accessed items. Update aliases based on user feedback and common usage patterns
entries.performanceNotes: Alias resolution adds <1ms overhead while maintaining sub-500ms response time requirement. O(1) dictionary lookup is extremely fast
entries.testingApproach: Both unit tests for resolve_path_alias() function and integration tests for API endpoint ensure comprehensive coverage
entries.mcpTesting: Use --mode rest flag to test with HTTP/curl instead of STDIO mode for easier debugging and verification

entries.lesson: Multi-tier fallback for resilience
entries.context: Building robust systems that handle various failure modes
entries.details: Implementation pattern: Try API → Load from disk → Use expired memory cache → Hardcoded fallback list
entries.impact: System remains functional even during complete API outages

entries.lesson: Binary serialization performance benefits
entries.context: Cache loading performance optimization
entries.details: msgpack reduces cache load time from 50ms (JSON) to 2ms for 100 crates
entries.impact: 25x improvement in cache loading performance

entries.lesson: SQLite WAL mode improves concurrency
entries.context: Database performance with concurrent access
entries.details: WAL mode enabled for better concurrency in multi-user scenarios
entries.impact: Reduced database lock contention

entries.lesson: Embeddings caching strategy
entries.context: Vector storage and reuse patterns
entries.details: Embeddings cached in SQLite for reuse across sessions
entries.impact: Significant performance improvement for repeated queries

entries.lesson: Batch processing for embeddings
entries.context: Optimizing embedding generation performance
entries.details: Use EMBEDDING_BATCH_SIZE=32 for optimal balance between memory usage and processing speed
entries.impact: Improved throughput while keeping memory usage reasonable

entries.lesson: Test isolation with cache directories
entries.context: Integration testing with shared cache state
entries.details: Always patch both ingest.CACHE_DIR and database.CACHE_DIR for integration tests to avoid state pollution
entries.impact: Prevents test failures due to shared state between test runs

entries.lesson: Batch insert rowid relationship management
entries.context: Maintaining foreign key relationships in batch database operations
entries.details: When batch inserting related data, calculate rowid range using last_rowid - batch_size + 1 to map parent-child relationships
entries.impact: Enables efficient batch processing while maintaining referential integrity

entries.lesson: Pre-serialize data before batch processing
entries.context: Optimizing batch insert performance with repeated serialization
entries.details: Pre-serialize vectors and other complex data structures before batching to avoid repeated serialization overhead
entries.impact: Reduces CPU usage and improves batch processing performance

entries.lesson: Batch processing maintains constant memory usage
entries.context: Memory optimization for large dataset processing
entries.details: Proper batch processing keeps memory usage constant regardless of total dataset size, preventing OOM errors
entries.impact: Enables processing of arbitrarily large datasets within memory constraints

entries.lesson: Test with >2x batch size for comprehensive validation
entries.context: Ensuring batch processing logic handles multiple batches correctly
entries.details: Create tests with datasets larger than 2x batch size to verify multiple batch handling and edge cases
entries.impact: Catches off-by-one errors and batch boundary issues during development

entries.lesson: Ruff formatting automatically fixes whitespace issues in docstrings
entries.context: Code quality and documentation formatting
entries.details: Ruff's formatting automatically handles whitespace and indentation issues in docstrings, maintaining consistent documentation format
entries.impact: Reduces manual formatting work and ensures consistent documentation style

entries.lesson: FastAPI metadata supports markdown in description field
entries.context: API documentation and OpenAPI schema generation
entries.details: FastAPI's app description field supports full markdown syntax for rich API documentation that appears in OpenAPI schema
entries.impact: Enables better API documentation with formatted text, links, and examples

entries.lesson: Pydantic examples parameter provides inline examples in OpenAPI schema
entries.context: API request/response documentation
entries.details: Using 'examples' parameter in Pydantic models automatically generates example data in OpenAPI schema for better API documentation
entries.impact: Improves API usability by providing clear examples in generated documentation

entries.lesson: Rate limiting documentation prevents user confusion with 429 errors
entries.context: API error handling and user experience
entries.details: Clear documentation of rate limits and proper HTTP 429 responses with retry headers helps users understand and handle rate limiting gracefully
entries.impact: Reduces support requests and improves API adoption by making rate limits transparent

entries.lesson: MCP manifest schemas need anyOf pattern for mixed-type parameters
entries.context: MCP clients send parameters with inconsistent types (strings vs integers)
entries.details: FastMCP has double validation - JSON Schema validation occurs before Pydantic field validators. Use anyOf: [{type: 'integer'}, {type: 'string'}] in MCP manifest to allow both types through schema validation, then handle type conversion in Pydantic with mode='before' field validators
entries.impact: Enables robust parameter handling that works across different MCP client implementations

entries.lesson: Database schema changes need backward compatibility
entries.context: Adding new columns to existing database tables during development
entries.details: Use NULL defaults for new columns in ALTER TABLE statements to ensure backward compatibility with existing databases
entries.impact: Prevents database migration issues and allows incremental schema updates

entries.lesson: Clear cache directory before testing enhanced parsing
entries.context: Testing database schema changes and parsing improvements
entries.details: Clear cache directory before testing enhanced parsing to ensure fresh database creation with new schema and updated parsing logic
entries.impact: Prevents test failures caused by stale database schemas or cached parsing results

entries.lesson: Always run Ruff formatting before committing
entries.context: Code quality and consistency maintenance
entries.details: Use 'uv run ruff format .' before committing to ensure consistent code formatting across the project
entries.impact: Maintains code quality and prevents formatting-related merge conflicts

entries.lesson: Use docs.rs as primary source for stdlib documentation
entries.context: Rust standard library documentation integration
entries.details: docs.rs provides comprehensive stdlib documentation access, simpler than attempting to use rust-docs-json component directly
entries.impact: Simplifies stdlib documentation access and reduces complexity compared to local JSON parsing

entries.lesson: Set lookup for O(1) stdlib crate detection
entries.context: Performance optimization for standard library crate identification
entries.details: Use Python set data structure for stdlib crate names to achieve O(1) lookup performance instead of list iteration
entries.impact: Significantly improves performance when processing many crates by eliminating linear search overhead

entries.lesson: Provide helpful error messages for stdlib download failures
entries.context: User experience when stdlib documentation is unavailable
entries.details: When stdlib documentation download fails, provide clear instructions explaining the limitation and suggesting alternatives
entries.impact: Improves user experience by explaining limitations rather than showing cryptic errors

entries.lesson: Async generator compatibility patterns
entries.context: Memory optimization implementation with streaming data processing
entries.details: parse_rustdoc_items must be async generator but generate_embeddings should be sync generator. Mixing async and sync generators requires careful handling - use wrapper functions for backwards compatibility
entries.impact: Enables streaming data processing while maintaining compatibility with existing sync code and tests

entries.lesson: Test compatibility with generators vs lists
entries.context: Maintaining backwards compatibility during streaming implementation
entries.details: Tests expect list-returning functions, not generators. Wrapper functions maintain backwards compatibility while enabling streaming optimizations. Integration tests are critical for streaming pipelines
entries.impact: Allows incremental migration to streaming while preserving existing test suite

entries.lesson: Memory monitoring implementation patterns
entries.context: Tracking memory usage during streaming operations
entries.details: psutil.virtual_memory().percent gives system-wide usage, process.memory_info().rss for process-specific monitoring. Trigger GC after processing chunks of 100+ items for optimal memory management
entries.impact: Enables proactive memory management preventing OOM errors during large dataset processing

entries.lesson: MemoryMonitor context manager pattern
entries.context: Operation-level memory tracking and reporting
entries.details: Use MemoryMonitor context manager for operation tracking - pre-serialize vectors before batch processing, clear buffers and trigger GC between batches
entries.impact: Provides structured memory management with clear operation boundaries and automatic cleanup

entries.lesson: Streaming error recovery strategies
entries.context: Error handling in streaming data processing pipelines
entries.details: Streaming requires different error recovery strategies than batch processing. Maintain per-batch transactions for database resilience, log memory status at key points for debugging
entries.impact: Improves system resilience by enabling partial recovery from processing errors without losing all work

entries.lesson: Score normalization for ranking consistency
entries.context: Implementing scoring algorithms for search ranking
entries.details: Always normalize scores to [0, 1] range for consistency. Use max(0.0, min(1.0, score)) clamping to ensure valid score ranges across different ranking factors
entries.impact: Prevents ranking inconsistencies and enables reliable score aggregation across multiple ranking factors

entries.lesson: Lazy imports for circular dependency resolution
entries.context: Avoiding circular dependency issues in module imports
entries.details: Lazy imports can resolve circular dependencies but may trigger linting warnings. Move imports to module level and use aliases (e.g., app_config) to avoid conflicts while maintaining clean code
entries.impact: Resolves circular dependency issues while maintaining code quality and IDE support

entries.lesson: SQLite connection pooling alternatives
entries.context: Database performance optimization strategies
entries.details: SQLite connections are lightweight; traditional connection pooling provides less benefit than query optimization. Focus on prepared statement caching and query optimization instead of connection pooling
entries.impact: Optimizes development effort toward more impactful performance improvements for SQLite-based systems

entries.lesson: Over-fetching for re-ranking flexibility
entries.context: Search result ranking and retrieval optimization
entries.details: Over-fetch results (k+10) to allow for re-ranking without constraining initial retrieval. Fetch more results than needed, apply ranking algorithms, then return top k to user
entries.impact: Enables sophisticated ranking algorithms without being constrained by initial retrieval limitations

entries.lesson: LRU cache with TTL for search performance
entries.context: Search result caching strategy for frequent queries
entries.details: Cache search results with LRU eviction and TTL to improve response times for frequent queries. Balances memory usage with performance gains for repeated searches
entries.impact: Significantly improves response times for repeated queries while managing memory usage effectively

entries.lesson: Always load sqlite-vec extension when testing database operations
entries.context: Vector similarity search and database testing
entries.details: The sqlite-vec extension must be loaded before performing any vector operations or database schema creation that depends on vector functionality. Failure to load the extension results in 'no such function' errors
entries.impact: Prevents vector operation failures and ensures consistent database functionality across testing and production environments

entries.lesson: Use Pydantic field_validator with mode='before' for flexible MCP parameter handling
entries.context: MCP protocol parameter type conversion and validation
entries.details: MCP clients may send parameters as different types (e.g., string '5' instead of integer 5). Using Pydantic field_validator with mode='before' allows flexible type conversion before validation. Combine with anyOf schema patterns in MCP manifests to pass JSON Schema validation
entries.impact: Enables robust parameter handling across different MCP client implementations while maintaining type safety

entries.lesson: Partial indexes significantly improve performance for common filter patterns
entries.context: Database query optimization for filtered searches
entries.details: Creating partial indexes on commonly filtered columns (e.g., WHERE item_type = 'function') dramatically improves query performance for specific filter patterns. Partial indexes are smaller and more targeted than full column indexes
entries.impact: Reduces query execution time for filtered searches by orders of magnitude, especially for common filter patterns

entries.lesson: Progressive filtering should only be used when result set is small (<10K items)
entries.context: Search result filtering and performance optimization
entries.details: Progressive filtering (applying filters after vector search) is only efficient when the initial result set is small. For large result sets, database-level filtering with proper indexes is more performant than in-memory filtering
entries.impact: Prevents performance degradation when dealing with large datasets by choosing appropriate filtering strategies

entries.lesson: Use anyOf schema pattern in MCP manifests for parameters that may arrive as strings
entries.context: MCP protocol schema validation and client compatibility
entries.details: MCP clients may send numeric parameters as strings due to JSON serialization. Use anyOf: [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}] in MCP manifest schemas to handle this variability. This allows JSON Schema validation to pass so Pydantic field validators can perform type coercion
entries.impact: Ensures compatibility with various MCP client implementations that may serialize parameters differently

entries.lesson: MCP parameter validation requires specific decorator ordering and validation patterns
entries.context: Implementing robust parameter validation for MCP protocol compatibility
entries.details: MCP parameter validation follows specific patterns: 1) Use @field_validator(mode='before') BEFORE @classmethod decorator (order matters!), 2) Check None first, then correct type, then string conversion, 3) Use anyOf schema in MCP manifest: {'anyOf': [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}]}, 4) Provide helpful error messages with examples, 5) Test both ValidationError (built-in constraints) and ValueError (custom validators)
entries.impact: Enables robust parameter handling across different MCP client implementations while maintaining type safety and clear error reporting

entries.lesson: Float vs integer string conversion have different error patterns
entries.context: Testing numeric parameter validation with different data types
entries.details: When testing string-to-numeric conversion failures: int() raises ValueError with 'invalid literal' message, while float() raises ValueError with 'could not convert' message. Test assertions must account for these different error message patterns
entries.impact: Ensures comprehensive test coverage for numeric parameter validation across different data types

entries.lesson: MCP Double Validation Pattern requires anyOf schema flexibility
entries.context: MCP tools have both JSON Schema and Pydantic validation layers
entries.details: MCP protocol applies JSON Schema validation before Pydantic field validators can run. When clients send mixed types (e.g., string '5' for integer field), restrictive schemas block validation. Solution: Use anyOf patterns in JSON Schema for flexibility: {'anyOf': [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}]}, then handle coercion in Pydantic field validators
entries.impact: Enables robust parameter handling across different MCP client implementations while maintaining type safety

entries.lesson: Decorator Order Critical for Pydantic field validators
entries.context: MCP parameter validation with custom field validators using classmethod decorator
entries.details: @field_validator must be placed BEFORE @classmethod decorator for proper decorator wrapping. Python decorators are applied bottom-up, so incorrect order (@classmethod @field_validator) prevents the validator from working properly. Correct pattern: @field_validator('field_name', mode='before') followed by @classmethod
entries.impact: Ensures field validators execute correctly and prevent runtime validation failures

entries.lesson: None Value Preservation in MCP parameter validators
entries.context: Handling default values and None inputs in MCP parameter validation
entries.details: Converting None to default values (e.g., 'latest') in validators breaks application logic that expects None for different default handling. Solution: Preserve None values in validators, handle defaults at application layer (e.g., in ingest_crate function). This allows proper conditional logic based on None vs explicit values
entries.impact: Maintains proper application logic flow and enables different default handling strategies

entries.lesson: Error Message Best Practices for MCP parameter validation
entries.context: Providing helpful error messages in Pydantic field validators
entries.details: Comprehensive error messages should include: 1) Field name for context, 2) Examples of valid values for guidance, 3) What was actually received (truncated to 100 chars to prevent log spam), 4) Clear format pattern. Example: f'{field_name} must be X. Got: {repr(value)[:100]}. Examples: ...'. This helps users understand validation failures and correct their input
entries.impact: Reduces user confusion and support requests by providing clear, actionable error messages

entries.lesson: Testing MCP Compatibility with multiple input types
entries.context: Ensuring MCP parameter validation works across different client implementations
entries.details: Comprehensive MCP validation testing requires: 1) Test with both native types (int, float) and string representations, 2) Use model_validate() to simulate JSON deserialization from MCP clients, 3) Verify whitespace trimming and null handling, 4) Test edge cases like empty strings and whitespace-only inputs, 5) Validate both ValidationError (built-in constraints) and ValueError (custom validators) paths
entries.impact: Ensures compatibility with various MCP client implementations and prevents runtime failures

entries.lesson: Check whitespace-only queries before stripping for proper error messages
entries.context: Query preprocessing and user input validation
entries.details: When validating user queries, check for whitespace-only content before stripping whitespace. This allows providing a specific error message for whitespace-only inputs instead of a generic 'empty query' message after stripping
entries.impact: Provides more helpful and accurate error messages to users, improving user experience

entries.lesson: NFKC normalization is irreversible but ideal for search and indexing
entries.context: Unicode text normalization for search queries
entries.details: Unicode NFKC (Normalization Form Compatibility Composition) is irreversible but excellent for search/indexing use cases. It handles ligatures (ﬀ → ff), fractions (½ → 1⁄2), superscripts/subscripts, and other compatibility characters. While information is lost, it creates consistent searchable text
entries.impact: Improves search accuracy and consistency by normalizing varied Unicode representations to canonical forms

entries.lesson: Preserve special technical characters during Unicode normalization
entries.context: Technical query processing with programming symbols
entries.details: Technical queries often contain important special characters like :: (scope resolution), <> (generics), # (doc comments). Unicode NFKC normalization preserves these characters while still handling compatibility issues with ligatures and fractions
entries.impact: Ensures technical search queries remain accurate while benefiting from Unicode normalization

entries.lesson: Provide helpful error messages with examples in Pydantic validators
entries.context: User input validation and error reporting
entries.details: Pydantic validators should include specific examples in error messages to help users understand what input is expected. For example, 'Query cannot be empty or contain only whitespace. Example: "Vec::new"' is more helpful than just 'Invalid query'
entries.impact: Reduces user confusion and support requests by providing clear guidance on correct input format

entries.lesson: Module path validation edge cases require careful pattern checking
entries.context: User input validation for module path patterns in search functionality
entries.details: Simple strip() validation can make invalid patterns like 'runtime::' appear valid. Check for trailing/leading '::' before stripping whitespace to catch malformed module paths. Invalid patterns should fail validation with clear error messages
entries.impact: Prevents invalid module path queries from reaching the database and provides clear feedback to users about correct module path syntax

entries.lesson: MCP manifest boolean parameter anyOf pattern implementation
entries.context: Fixing MCP client boolean parameter validation errors in search_items tool
entries.details: MCP clients can send boolean parameters as strings ('true', 'false') which fails JSON Schema validation. Solution requires anyOf pattern in manifest: {'anyOf': [{'type': 'boolean'}, {'type': 'string'}]}. This allows FastMCP's JSON Schema validation to pass so Pydantic field validators can perform conversion with mode='before'. Server testing shows port 8000 (not 8080) for REST mode endpoints
entries.impact: Enables compatibility with MCP clients that serialize boolean parameters as strings while maintaining type safety through Pydantic validation
entries.validationFlow: MCP manifest anyOf → FastMCP JSON Schema → Pydantic field_validator → Boolean conversion
entries.testingNotes: Use --mode rest to test MCP manifest endpoints at localhost:8000

entries.lesson: Code example extraction performance optimization
entries.context: Implementation of search_examples functionality for retrieving code examples
entries.details: search_examples successfully returns results in ~200ms for warm queries. Language detection adds minimal overhead during ingestion. Deduplication by hash is efficient for preventing duplicates during batch processing
entries.impact: Enables fast code example retrieval with minimal performance impact from language detection and deduplication

entries.lesson: Backward compatibility patterns for data format changes
entries.context: Handling transition from old list-based code examples to new JSON object format
entries.details: When changing data formats, implement compatibility checks that detect old formats and convert them to new formats automatically. Example: detecting list of strings vs list of objects and converting appropriately with default values
entries.impact: Ensures seamless upgrades without breaking existing cached data or requiring manual migration

entries.lesson: Database schema extraction patterns from file paths
entries.context: Extracting metadata from database file structure when schema doesn't include all needed fields
entries.details: When database schema lacks certain fields (like crate_version), extract information from file structure patterns. Use db_path.parent.name for crate name and db_path.stem for version from cache/{crate}/{version}.db structure
entries.impact: Enables metadata extraction without requiring database schema changes or migrations

entries.lesson: Database path extraction pattern for module search
entries.context: Converting database file paths to crate names for module pattern construction
entries.details: Use db_path.parent.name to extract crate name from cache/{crate}/{version}.db structure. Module search patterns follow format: f'{crate_name}::{module_path}::%' for SQL LIKE queries
entries.impact: Enables efficient module-scoped search by properly constructing database queries with correct crate and module path patterns

entries.lesson: Cache key generation must include all filter parameters
entries.context: Maintaining cache consistency when adding new search parameters
entries.details: When adding new filter parameters to search functions, always update _make_key(), get(), and set() methods to include the new parameters. Maintain consistent parameter ordering across all methods to ensure cache hits work correctly
entries.impact: Prevents cache misses and incorrect result caching when new search parameters are added, ensuring search results remain accurate and performant

entries.lesson: FastAPI validation error testing patterns
entries.context: Testing Pydantic validation errors in FastAPI applications
entries.details: FastAPI returns HTTP 422 status for Pydantic validation errors. Error details are available in response.json()['detail'] as an array of error objects. Test both the status code and specific error message content
entries.impact: Enables comprehensive testing of input validation by properly checking both HTTP status and detailed error information

entries.lesson: Background server testing with clean process management
entries.context: Testing server applications without blocking terminal sessions
entries.details: Use nohup with output redirection and PID capture for clean server testing: 'nohup uv run uvicorn docsrs_mcp.app:app > server.log 2>&1 & echo $!'. Capture the PID for clean shutdown with kill command
entries.impact: Prevents terminal hanging during server testing and enables clean process cleanup, improving development workflow

entries.lesson: SearchCache incompatibility with simple string caching needs
entries.context: Implementing fuzzy path resolution with caching for performance
entries.details: SearchCache is designed for embedding-based searches with complex cache key structures, not simple string-based path caching. For simple path caching needs, implement a basic dictionary cache with TTL instead of trying to adapt SearchCache to different use cases
entries.impact: Prevents over-engineering caching solutions and ensures appropriate tool selection for specific caching requirements

entries.lesson: FastAPI HTTPException detail format requirements
entries.context: Returning structured error responses with suggestions in FastAPI
entries.details: HTTPException with dictionary detail causes 500 error instead of proper status code handling. FastAPI expects string detail for proper error response processing. Include error suggestions directly in the error message text rather than as separate detail fields
entries.impact: Ensures proper HTTP status code handling and prevents unexpected 500 errors when returning structured error information

entries.lesson: TestClient async fixture compatibility patterns
entries.context: Testing async endpoints with FastAPI TestClient and pytest fixtures
entries.details: TestClient operates synchronously while async fixtures can cause compatibility issues. Mock at the appropriate abstraction level and use synchronous test functions with TestClient rather than trying to mix async fixtures with sync test clients
entries.impact: Prevents test fixture compatibility issues and ensures reliable test execution patterns

entries.lesson: RapidFuzz integration best practices for fallback search
entries.context: Implementing fuzzy string matching as fallback for exact path lookups
entries.details: RapidFuzz integrates cleanly with minimal code changes when used as fallback-only approach. This preserves exact match performance while adding fuzzy matching capability. Cache paths per crate to avoid repeated database queries and improve fuzzy search performance
entries.impact: Enables fuzzy search capabilities without impacting exact match performance, providing better user experience for path resolution

entries.lesson: SlowAPI rate limiting implementation gotchas
entries.context: Implementing rate limiting with SlowAPI middleware in FastAPI applications
entries.details: SlowAPI requires: 1) Request parameter MUST be included in endpoint function signatures or rate limiting won't work, 2) Middleware order matters - last added is outermost, 3) Memory backend doesn't share state between workers, use Redis for production, 4) Use limiter.limit() decorator on each endpoint that needs rate limiting, 5) Set app.state.limiter after app initialization for proper integration
entries.impact: Ensures proper rate limiting implementation and prevents common configuration issues that lead to ineffective rate limiting

entries.lesson: Rate limiting testing requires concurrent request patterns
entries.context: Testing rate limiting functionality to ensure proper enforcement
entries.details: Effective rate limiting tests require: 1) Use concurrent requests (asyncio.gather) to test rate limiting behavior, 2) Verify both successful responses (200) and rate-limited responses (429), 3) Check that health/monitoring endpoints remain unprotected, 4) Test rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-*) in responses, 5) Validate that rate limits reset properly over time
entries.impact: Ensures rate limiting works correctly under realistic concurrent load conditions and provides proper feedback to clients

entries.lesson: Rate limiting integration patterns for clean code organization
entries.context: Organizing rate limiting code for maintainability and separation of concerns
entries.details: Best practices for rate limiting integration: 1) Create dedicated middleware.py for clean separation from main app logic, 2) Use limiter.limit() decorator on individual endpoints for granular control, 3) Set app.state.limiter after app initialization to ensure proper middleware access, 4) Add custom exception handler for RateLimitExceeded to provide consistent error responses, 5) Configure different limits for different endpoint types (search vs health checks)
entries.impact: Maintains clean code architecture while enabling flexible and maintainable rate limiting configuration

entries.lesson: Path alias resolution implementation for improved user experience
entries.context: Implementing path alias resolution to handle common user path shortcuts in Rust documentation search
entries.details: Users often use common aliases like 'serde::Deserialize' instead of full rustdoc paths 'serde::de::Deserialize'. Solution: 1) Implement static PATH_ALIASES dictionary with O(1) lookup, 2) Create resolve_path_alias() function in fuzzy_resolver.py, 3) Add mapping for common patterns: serde::Deserialize → serde::de::Deserialize, tokio::spawn → tokio::task::spawn, Result → std::result::Result, 4) Integrate before database query for minimal performance impact (<1ms overhead), 5) Test with both unit tests and integration tests for comprehensive coverage
entries.impact: Significantly improves user experience by handling common path aliases automatically while maintaining sub-500ms response time requirements. Reduces 404 errors for commonly accessed items
entries.testingStrategy: Use --mode rest flag for easier HTTP/curl testing instead of STDIO mode during development and verification

entries.lesson: PATH_ALIASES expansion for common Rust patterns
entries.context: Improving path resolution for common Rust module patterns and shortcuts
entries.details: Expand PATH_ALIASES in fuzzy_resolver.py with common patterns like 'tokio::spawn': 'tokio::task::spawn' to improve user experience when searching with abbreviated paths
entries.impact: Reduces friction for users who use common shorthand patterns when searching for Rust functions and modules

implementationNotes.aliasPatterns: Focus on commonly used shortcuts like tokio::spawn -> tokio::task::spawn
implementationNotes.performanceImpact: O(1) dictionary lookup adds minimal overhead
implementationNotes.maintenanceStrategy: Add aliases based on user feedback and common usage patterns

entries.lesson: Debug mode parameter for search query analysis
entries.context: Adding debug capabilities for analyzing search query performance and scoring
entries.details: Add debug=true parameter to search queries to return detailed scoring information including similarity scores, filter matches, and performance metrics
entries.impact: Enables better understanding of search behavior and troubleshooting of relevance issues

implementationNotes.debugOutput: Include similarity scores, filter matches, query timing, and result ranking details
implementationNotes.performanceConsideration: Only enable debug output when explicitly requested to avoid performance overhead
implementationNotes.useCases: Query optimization, relevance tuning, and search behavior analysis

entries.lesson: See-also suggestions implementation patterns
entries.context: Implementing related suggestions functionality for search results with proper deduplication and graceful error handling
entries.details: See-also suggestions require: 1) Exclude original search results to avoid duplicates using path exclusion sets, 2) Use similarity = 1.0 - distance for sqlite-vec cosine similarity scoring, 3) Add suggestions only to first search result to avoid UI redundancy, 4) Implement graceful degradation with empty suggestions array on any exception, 5) Mock Path objects with MagicMock(spec=Path) in tests with proper exists() method configuration
entries.impact: Provides valuable related content discovery while maintaining clean UI and robust error handling

implementationNotes.deduplication: Use set comprehension for O(1) path exclusion: exclude_paths = {result.path for result in original_results}
implementationNotes.scoringFormula: Convert distance to similarity: similarity = 1.0 - distance (sqlite-vec uses cosine distance)
implementationNotes.uiOptimization: Add suggestions only to first result to prevent overwhelming the interface
implementationNotes.errorHandling: Return empty suggestions array on exceptions to maintain search functionality
implementationNotes.testingPatterns: Mock Path objects with spec parameter and configure exists() method explicitly

entries.lesson: Graceful degradation patterns for optional features
entries.context: Implementing see-also suggestions as optional enhancement that doesn't break core functionality
entries.details: Optional features should: 1) Never throw exceptions that break core functionality, 2) Return empty/null results on failure, 3) Log errors for debugging but continue execution, 4) Provide clear fallback behavior when external dependencies fail, 5) Design with graceful degradation from the start rather than adding it later
entries.impact: Ensures core search functionality remains reliable even when optional features encounter errors

entries.lesson: UI redundancy prevention in suggestion systems
entries.context: Preventing information overload when displaying related suggestions to users
entries.details: Suggestion systems should: 1) Only add suggestions to primary or first result to avoid repetition, 2) Exclude original search results from suggestions to provide new information, 3) Limit suggestion count to prevent overwhelming users (typically 3-5 suggestions), 4) Consider UI space and user attention when designing suggestion placement, 5) Make suggestions clearly distinguishable from primary results
entries.impact: Improves user experience by providing valuable suggestions without cluttering the interface

entries.lesson: Rustdoc JSON impl block representation patterns
entries.context: Implementing trait implementation search functionality in rustdoc JSON parsing
entries.details: Rustdoc JSON represents impl blocks with empty names, requiring extraction from inner.trait and inner.for fields. Composite names like 'TraitName_for_TypeName' work well for impl block identification. Inherent impls (no trait) can be handled by checking for null trait field. The existing streaming parser architecture easily accommodates new item types without structural changes.
entries.impact: Enables accurate trait implementation search without requiring database schema changes by leveraging existing item_type field patterns. Provides flexible naming scheme for both trait impls and inherent impls.

implementationNotes.emptyNames: Impl blocks have empty name field - extract from inner.trait and inner.for instead
implementationNotes.inherentImpls: Check trait field for null to identify inherent implementations vs trait implementations
implementationNotes.streamingCompatible: Existing streaming parser handles new impl item types without architecture changes
implementationNotes.schemaCompatible: No database schema changes needed - uses existing item_type field infrastructure

parsingPatterns.traitImpl: Extract from inner.trait.name and inner.for to create composite identifier
parsingPatterns.inherentImpl: Use inner.for as identifier when inner.trait is null
parsingPatterns.typeExtraction: Both trait and for fields may contain complex type information requiring careful parsing
parsingPatterns.nameGeneration: Generate meaningful searchable names from otherwise empty name fields in rustdoc JSON

entries.lesson: Background task reference management patterns
entries.context: Implementing background schedulers with proper task lifecycle management
entries.details: Background tasks must maintain strong references to prevent garbage collection. Use a set data structure (self.background_tasks = set()) to store task references, then add callback functions with task.add_done_callback(lambda t: self.background_tasks.discard(t)) for automatic cleanup when tasks complete
entries.impact: Prevents background tasks from being garbage collected prematurely while ensuring proper cleanup to avoid memory leaks
entries.codePattern: self.background_tasks = set(); task = asyncio.create_task(func()); self.background_tasks.add(task); task.add_done_callback(lambda t: self.background_tasks.discard(t))

entries.lesson: Jitter implementation for distributed scheduler coordination
entries.context: Preventing synchronized execution when multiple schedulers run simultaneously
entries.details: Add random jitter to scheduler intervals using formula: base_interval + random.uniform(-jitter_range, jitter_range). Default ±10% variance (jitter_range = base_interval * 0.1) provides good distribution without significantly affecting scheduling accuracy
entries.impact: Prevents thundering herd problems when multiple scheduler instances start simultaneously, distributing load more evenly

entries.lesson: Memory-aware background task scheduling
entries.context: Implementing resource-conscious background operations to prevent OOM errors
entries.details: Check system memory usage before starting memory-intensive background tasks using psutil.virtual_memory().percent. Set reasonable thresholds (e.g., 80%) to leave headroom for memory spikes during processing. Skip operations when memory usage is too high and reschedule for next interval
entries.impact: Prevents out-of-memory errors during background processing while maintaining system stability under varying load conditions

implementationNotes.fallbackBehavior: Skip operation and wait for next scheduled interval

entries.lesson: Environment-driven scheduler configuration best practices
entries.context: Making background schedulers configurable without requiring code changes
entries.details: Use environment variables for all scheduler settings: enable/disable flags, intervals, memory thresholds, and jitter ranges. Default to enabled for better user experience but provide clear disable mechanism (SCHEDULER_ENABLED=false) for resource-constrained deployments. Document all configuration options clearly
entries.impact: Enables flexible deployment configurations without code modifications while maintaining good defaults for most use cases

entries.lesson: Background task testing patterns with timeouts
entries.context: Testing background schedulers and long-running tasks in test suites
entries.details: Use asyncio.wait_for() with short timeouts when testing background tasks. Background tasks will timeout (expected behavior), but this allows testing of initialization, configuration, and cleanup without waiting for full execution cycles. Test both enabled and disabled states for backward compatibility
entries.impact: Enables comprehensive testing of background task systems without extending test suite execution time or requiring complex mocking

testingPatterns.statesTesting: Test both enabled=True and enabled=False configurations
